title: 84/39/EEC: Commission Decision of 13 January 1984 laying down certain measures to prevent the spread of avian influenza
header:
COMMISSION  DECISION
of 13 January 1984
laying down certain measures to prevent the spread of avian influenza
(84/39/EEC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN
COMMUNITIES
main_body: The Member States shall prohibit the introduction into their territory of fresh poultrymeat obtained after 15 October 1983 from poultry coming from a zone of a five-kilometre radius around the outbreaks of avian influenza in Ireland.

The health certificate provided for in Directive 71/118/EEC accompanying fresh poultrymeat sent from Ireland must bear the following entry: 'Meat complying with Commission Decision 83/39/EEC of 13 January 1984.'
The Commission will follow developments and will if necessary amend this Decision as a result thereof.
The Member States shall amend the measures which they apply to trade, in order to adapt them to this Decision.
This Decision is addressed to the Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 13 January 1984.
For the Commission
Poul DALSAGER
Member of the Commission
